summary: Two men were charged in the death of a Chicago teen who performed at an inauguration event. The Carnival Triumph cruise ship, which experienced a fire in its engine room, is being towed to Mobile, Alabama, instead of Mexico. Discussions are ongoing about the possibility of the next pope being from Africa or Latin America.
Mohammed Bouazizi, a 26-year-old unemployed fruit stand owner in Tunisia, set himself on fire after a policewoman confiscated his unlicensed produce stand. This act sparked the Jasmine Revolution.
The Jasmine Revolution in Tunisia led to the ousting of President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali, ending his 23-year reign and forcing him into exile.
Mass protests began in Egypt against President Hosni Mubarak's regime, which had been in power since 1981, as part of a broader pro-democracy movement in the Arab world.
